body_html:
Hmm, so there's two possible wheel configurations: one compiled with numpy support (and numpy listed as dependency), and another one without numpy.

It seems that our conda builds list numpy as a runtime dependency, so we should probably do the same thing for the wheels?
body_text:
Hmm, so there's two possible wheel configurations: one compiled with numpy support (and numpy listed as dependency), and another one without numpy.
It seems that our conda builds list numpy as a runtime dependency, so we should probably do the same thing for the wheels?
body:
Hmm, so there's two possible wheel configurations: one compiled with numpy support (and numpy listed as dependency), and another one without numpy.

It seems that our conda builds list [numpy as a runtime dependency](https://github.com/pytorch/builder/blob/master/conda/pytorch-cuda80-0.1.12/meta.yaml#L21), so we should probably do the same thing for the wheels?
